skill.name: suggesting-improvements
skill.description: Expert at suggesting specific, actionable improvements to Claude's responses and work. Use when Claude's output needs enhancement, when quality issues are identified, or when iterating on solutions.

security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based skill containing only instructional markdown documentation. All 68 static findings are false positives triggered by code examples in the documentation that teach improvement patterns. The skill has read-only tool access (Read, Grep, Glob) and contains no executable code.

content.user_title: Suggest specific improvements for code and responses
content.value_statement: Claude sometimes produces outputs that need refinement. This skill provides structured frameworks for identifying issues and suggesting concrete improvements with before and after examples.
actual_capabilities: Identifies specific issues in code, responses, and solutions
Provides structured frameworks for categorizing improvements
Shows before and after examples for common patterns
Suggests alternative approaches with trade-off analysis
Creates verification steps to confirm improvements work
limitations: Only suggests improvements and does not implement changes automatically
Requires Claude to invoke the skill with appropriate context
Cannot access runtime environments or execute tests
Limited to read-only file access tools

use_cases.title: Code quality enhancement
use_cases.description: Get specific suggestions for improving code structure, performance, security, and maintainability with clear examples.

use_cases.title: Documentation improvement
use_cases.description: Receive guidance on making explanations clearer, adding examples, and organizing documentation better.

use_cases.title: Structured review feedback
use_cases.description: Apply consistent frameworks for providing actionable, prioritized improvement suggestions in reviews.

prompt_templates.title: Quick code review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this code and suggest specific improvements with before and after examples.

prompt_templates.title: Response refinement
prompt_templates.prompt: My previous response about [topic] could be better. Suggest specific improvements to make it clearer.

prompt_templates.title: Pattern application
prompt_templates.prompt: This code has [issue type]. Apply the appropriate improvement pattern and show how to refactor it.

prompt_templates.title: Priority ranking
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze these changes and prioritize the improvements by impact level. Explain the rationale for each priority.

output_examples.input: Suggest improvements for this Python function that validates user input
output: Issue: Function lacks input validation which may cause runtime errors
Suggested change: Add type checking and value validation at function start
Benefits: Prevents errors, improves security, provides clearer error messages

output_examples.input: How can I make this technical explanation clearer for beginners?
output: Issue: Explanation uses jargon without definitions
Suggested change: Start with a simple analogy before introducing technical terms
Example: Use restaurant ordering analogy for async/await concepts

best_practices: Be specific about what to change. Show exact code or text that needs improvement.
Always provide before and after examples to demonstrate the suggested improvement.
Prioritize suggestions by impact to help focus on what matters most.
anti_patterns: Making vague suggestions like 'make it better' without specific changes
Suggesting improvements without explaining why they are beneficial
Presenting only one approach without discussing trade-offs or alternatives

faq.question: How does this skill differ from a code review tool?
faq.answer: This skill provides frameworks for Claude to suggest improvements. It does not automatically analyze or modify code.

faq.question: What tools can Claude use with this skill?
faq.answer: The skill has read-only tools (Read, Grep, Glob) for examining code without making changes.

faq.question: Can this skill implement the improvements it suggests?
faq.answer: No, this skill only suggests improvements. You need to use additional tools to implement changes.

faq.question: Does this skill work with any programming language?
faq.answer: Yes, the improvement frameworks are language-agnostic and apply to any code or text.

faq.question: Why are only read tools allowed?
faq.answer: The skill focuses on analysis and suggestion. Write tools are not needed for identifying improvements.

faq.question: How do I apply the prioritization framework?
faq.answer: The skill classifies improvements as Critical, Important, Minor, or Future. Focus on Critical items first.
